TockyML 0.1.0
  • Reference

Perform Timer transformation on flow cytometry data

Source: R/TockyDataPreprocessing.R
timer_transform.Rd

This function processes flow cytometry data by performing FSC correction, normalization, and trigonometric transformation on Blue and Red fluorescence data.

timer_transform(
  prep,
  output = NULL,
  FSC.control = FALSE,
  correct.red = TRUE,
  blue.channel = NULL,
  red.channel = NULL,
  xlim.red = NULL,
  ylim.blue = NULL,
  interactive.gating = FALSE,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

prep

A list containing file paths and variables, typically the output from `prep_tocky`.

output

Optional character string specifying the output directory for saving files. If `NULL`, no files are saved.

FSC.control

Logical indicating whether to use a separate FSC control file. Default is `FALSE`.

correct.red

Logical indicating whether to correct the Red channel for FSC. Default is `TRUE`.

blue.channel

Character string specifying the Blue channel name. If `NULL`, the function will attempt to determine it automatically.

red.channel

Character string specifying the Red channel name. If `NULL`, the function will attempt to determine it automatically.

xlim.red

Numeric value for the Red channel gating threshold. If `NULL`, automatic or interactive gating is performed.

ylim.blue

Numeric value for the Blue channel gating threshold. If `NULL`, automatic or interactive gating is performed.

interactive.gating

Logical indicating whether to perform interactive gating when thresholds are not provided. Default is `FALSE`.

verbose

Logical indicating whether to print progress messages. Default is `TRUE`.

Value

A list containing: - `transformed_data`: Data frame with angle, intensity, and other variables. - `normalization_parameters`: List with normalization values and coefficients. - `cell_counts`: Data frame with cell counts for each sample. - `sample_definition`: Data frame with sample file names and placeholder group column.

See also

Other Tocky Datapreprocessing: log_data(), prep_tocky(), sample_definition()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Assuming `prep_data` is the output from `prep_tocky`
  result <- timer_transform(prep_data, correct.red = TRUE)
} # }
